name: 歐洲電影與旅行
description: This course aims to offer a chronological review of the history of European cinema in its relationship to tourism and travel. By embedding cinematic discourse against the larger background of modern European history, we will be able to further understand the conflicting dynamics at work in the constant identity negotiations of the European cultures in modernity, as well as investigate more deeply the many changes in the contexts of European travel and tourism since the 1890s until today.
goals: -to explore issues related to the making of the modern European identity through the medium of cinema
-to understand cinema as a modern/post-modern medium and its significance in fashioning European cultures in the last 120 years
-to explore travel forms, practices, locales, etc. as products of cinematic strategies
-to explore the politics of national and transnational cinema and its role in the making of the European identity
syllabus:
1.     Introduction: “reading” a film. / Early experiments: developing a new visual art (1)

2.     Early experiments: developing a new visual art (2) / The international expansion of cinema, 1905-1919 (1)

3.     Avenues and dead-ends: groping for ‘real’ cinema; cinema travelogues / The international expansion of cinema, 1905-1919 (2)

4.     The late silent era, 1919-1929 (1)

5.     Fantasies of travel, utopias, surrealist experiments / The late silent era, 1919-1929 (2)

6.     Soviet montage

7.     The late 1920s and sound / Theorizing the new medium: cinema, modernity, representation

8.     1930s to 1945 (1)

9.     1930s to 1945 (2) / Tourism, power, propaganda / Citycinema (1)

10.  The art of the documentary (1) / Post-war European cinema (1945-1959) (1)

11.  Post-war European cinema (1945-1959) (2)

12.  Art cinema, the idea of authorship & new waves (1) / Citycinema (2)

13.  Art cinema, the idea of authorship & new waves (2)

14.  New trends, new developments / Cinema on the road

15.  The 1980s and beyond / Citycinema (3)

16.  The art of the documentary (2) / Film & tourism, other possibilities
